title: Western Australian home transformed into Gingerbread House, inspired by fairy tale Hansel and Gretel
text:
An adorable 1920s cottage that was transformed into a gingerbread house is up for sale.

The spacious home in Boyanup, Western Australia, was transformed by owners Julie Shadbolt and Jim Earley, and opened on February 21, 2015.

The couple, who were mining sector workers, where struggling to maintain a regular job and decided to give tourism a try.

The spacious home in Boyanup, Western Australia was transformed by owners Julie Shadbolt and Jim Earley, on February 21, 2015

The couple, who were mining sector workers, where struggling to maintain a regular job and decided to give tourism a try

After renovating the house, the pair were selling a huge range of lollies, chocolates, waffles, cakes, and gingerbread

After renovating the house with inspiration from the childhood fairy tale Hansel and Gretel, the pair opened the home up to the public.

They sell a huge range of lollies, chocolates, waffles, cakes, and gingerbread.

The Instagrammable cottage has brought visitors from all over Australia who are looking to take a cute photo.

And if you want to have a sit down with a tea, while the children have fun, you should head over to The Sitting Room

However, the couple have a business in Perth which they want to focus on and have put the Gingerbread House up for sale

There are also three rooms for different occasions, depending on what you want to do while visiting the delicious looking home.

There is a Carnival Room - where you can celebrate your next birthday or have a high tea, as well as a chance to design your own lolly buffet in The Lolly Buffet Room.

And if you want to have a sit down with a tea, while the children have fun, you should head over to The Sitting Room.

There is a large background area for children to play in while their parents look on (pictured)

Visitors have the option to make their own lolly buffet in the Lolly Buffet Room

However, the couple have a business in Perth which they want to focus on and have put the Gingerbread House up for sale.

'Running two businesses 200km apart has been a bit tiring,' Ms Shadbolt told The West.

'We had to make a call, but it breaks my heart to leave.'
description: The spacious home in Boyanup, Western Australia was transformed by owners Julie Shadbolt and Jim Earley, on February 21, 2015.
authors: Sahar Mourad For Daily Mail Australia
